stories.text:
I am a self-taught frontend developer with a couple years of experience. Though software engineering is a broad term that may cover some aspects of what I do professionally, I do not consider myself a software engineer. Maybe it's the lack of formal CS education or having minimal experience developing actual products instead of interfaces for them.

Is being a software engineer a state of mind or an actual profession that comes with certain prerequisites?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to become a software engineer as a self-taught front end developer?
Sichuan-Tibet rail project at full steam as workers wilt, machines melt

stories.text:
I have a limited time and need to quickly ramp up on these skills. I need hands-on experience as that's how I learn best. What would be your go-to resource/workshop for that?

Is there some standard "here are existing 10 services and in this guide we'll go through deploying them, securing them, installing service mesh, provisioning database..." kind of thing?
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the fastest way to ramp up on DevOps, k8 and GCP?
Brains are getting 5% smaller in humans in the latest 50,000 years
Real-World Concurrency with Ruby and Polyphony: A Telnet Chat App
The most valuable Spanish coins in history
Microsoft Calls Firefox’s Browser Workaround “Improper,” Will Block It

stories.text: We built an Invoicing & Inventory app for Small Businesses. I'm aware Netsuite is usually preferred by large businesses. Do startups or small businesses use Netsuite? If we could integrate our mobile app to netsuite will it be helpful for SMB? Please share your thoughts.
stories.title: Ask HN: Will Invoicing mobile app and Netsuite integration work?
